moon.calendar_description: Check moon phases to plan your astronomical tours in the Atacama Desert
moon.why_matters_title: Why does the moon phase matter?
moon.why_matters_description: In the Atacama Desert, the moon phase is crucial for astronomical observation. During a full moon, its brightness can make it difficult to see stars and deep-sky objects. The best times for astronomy are during the new moon or waxing/waning phases.

seo.title: Moon Calendar - Northern Chile Tours
seo.description: Check moon phases to plan your astronomical tours in San Pedro de Atacama. Discover the best dates to observe the sky in the clearest desert in the world.
seo.og_title: Atacama Moon Calendar - Plan Your Astronomical Tour
seo.og_description: Check lunar phases and plan the best date for your astronomical experience in the Atacama Desert with clear skies.

home.cta_subtitle: Join us on an unforgettable astronomical adventure

experience.title: More than a tour, a connection
experience.subtitle: In the heart of the world's driest desert, we invite you to gaze at the universe with fresh eyes. Where science, history, and nature merge under the same sky.
experience.astro_desc: You won't just look at stars: you'll learn to read them. Our guides, experts in astronomy and Andean worldview, reveal the secrets of the cosmos and how ancient peoples interpreted it.
experience.geo_desc: Connect with living geology. From the salt mirrors of the Hidden Lagoons of Baltinache to the mineral palette of the Rainbow Valley. Walk upon golden dunes that narrate millions of years of history.

seo.title: About Us - Northern Chile
seo.description: Learn about the history and team behind Northern Chile, your expert guide for astronomical tours in San Pedro de Atacama.
seo.og_description: Learn about the history and team behind Northern Chile

about.title: About Northern Chile
about.subtitle: Connecting people with the universe from the clearest desert in the world
about.historyP1: Northern Chile was born from 15 years of passion for astronomical tourism in the Atacama Desert. We do not simply sell a tour; we sell an experience of knowledge, a true show under the stars.
about.historyP2: We created an "Open-Air Auditorium" where our visitors lie down at the foot of the desert to connect the sky with the ground. It is a natural experience that involves walking through the dunes, equipped with professional telescopes (Celestron 8se, Skywatcher equatorial, Celestron 114 LSM, Seestar S50zvw) and cameras to capture the magic of the moment.
about.historyP3: We were awarded the "Best Tour of Atacama" prize last year, and our agency was selected among the top 9 in San Pedro by tourism representatives. Our founder participated as the voice-over for the astronomical tour at the VIVA Antofagasta fair.
about.historyP4: The Atacama skies are completely different every 6 months, offering unique experiences depending on the time of year. We invite you to discover why the Atacama Desert is considered one of the best places in the world for astronomical observation.

values.experience_description: We don't sell tours, we sell an educational show under the desert stars
values.equipment_description: 4 high-end telescopes and professional cameras for an unforgettable experience
values.quality_description: Awarded as the best Atacama tour and selected among the 9 best in San Pedro
values.auditorium_description: We create an open-air auditorium where you connect the sky with the desert ground

alex.bio: 15 years of experience in astronomical tourism in Bolivia and San Pedro de Atacama. Award for the best tour in Atacama.

credentials.award: Winner of the best Atacama tour award
credentials.voice_over: Voice-over for the astronomical tour at the VIVA Antofagasta fair

david.bio: Specialist in astronomical and night photography. Captures the magic of the Atacama sky combining professional technique and artistic vision.

credentials.art_teacher: Art teacher with a focus on night photography

q1.question: Do I need previous astronomy experience?
q1.answer: No, our tours are designed for all levels. Our guides will explain everything you need to know.

q2.question: What happens if there is bad weather?
q2.answer: We constantly monitor weather conditions. If canceled due to bad weather, we offer rescheduling or full refund.

q3.question: Do tours include transportation?
q3.answer: Yes, all our tours include transportation from your accommodation in San Pedro de Atacama.

q4.question: Can I make a private reservation?
q4.answer: Yes, we offer private tours. Contact us to coordinate a personalized experience.

terms.title: Terms and Conditions
terms.intro: Welcome to Northern Chile. By booking our services, you agree to the following terms and conditions, governed by the Consumer Law (19.496) and the Personal Data Protection Law (21.719) of the Republic of Chile.

sections.title: 1. Reservations, Prices, and Payments
sections.content: To confirm a reservation, full payment or the deposit indicated at checkout is required. All prices are in Chilean Pesos (CLP) and include VAT (19%). We accept Webpay Plus, QR, and international cards. The reservation is only perfected upon receipt of the voucher in your email.

sections.title: 2. Exclusion of the Right of Withdrawal
sections.content: IMPORTANT: Pursuant to article 3 bis, letter b) of Law No. 19.496, Northern Chile expressly declares that the right of withdrawal (unilateral regret without cause within 10 days) DOES NOT apply to the contracting of its tourism services. Refunds will be governed exclusively by our Cancellation Policies.

sections.title: 3. Health and Passenger Responsibility
sections.content: Tours take place between 2,400 and 4,300 meters above sea level. It is the passenger's obligation to declare pre-existing medical conditions before booking. Northern Chile is not responsible for health problems derived from altitude if the client omitted such information. We reserve the right of admission for unsafe conduct or substance influence.

sections.title: 4. Conduct and 'Leave No Trace'
sections.content: We strictly adhere to sustainable tourism principles. Extracting geological material, feeding wildlife, or leaving waste is prohibited. Non-compliance may result in expulsion from the tour without refund and reporting to authorities if applicable.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy and Data Protection
privacy.intro: Complying with Law 21.719, Northern Chile guarantees the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of your personal data.

sections.title: 1. Data Controller and Consent
sections.content: Northern Chile (San Pedro de Atacama) is the data controller for your data. The legal basis for processing is the execution of the tourism service contract and your explicit and informed consent at the time of booking.

sections.title: 2. Collected Data and Purpose
sections.content: We collect: Identification (Name, ID/Passport), Contact (Email, Phone), and Health Data (only if relevant for altitude safety). The purpose is exclusively operational (booking management), commercial (sending vouchers), and safety. We do not transfer or sell data to third parties, except under legal obligation.

sections.title: 3. ARCOP Rights (Your Rights)
sections.content: You have the right to: Access (know what data we have), Rectification (correct errors), Cancellation (delete your data), Opposition (refuse certain uses), and Portability (take your data). To exercise them, write to our Data Protection Officer at contacto{'@'}northernchile.com. We will respond within legal deadlines.

sections.title: 4. Security and Incident Notification
sections.content: We implement SSL/TLS security protocols and restricted access. In the unlikely event of a security breach affecting your rights, we will notify the competent authority and those affected as stipulated in Law 21.719.

cancellation.title: Cancellation and Refund Policies
cancellation.intro: Our policies are designed to be fair to both the traveler and the local logistics operation.

more_than_24h.title: More than 24 hours
more_than_24h.description: 95% refund or free rescheduling. 5% retained for processing fees.

less_than_24h.title: Less than 24 hours
less_than_24h.description: No refund. Considered a No-Show as spots have been blocked.

sections.title: 1. Cancellation by the Client (24h Rule)
sections.content: 95% Refund: If you cancel MORE than 24 hours before the tour starts, 95% of the amount paid will be refunded. The remaining 5% covers payment processing costs (Transbank/MercadoPago commissions + VAT). No Refund: If you cancel LESS than 24 hours before or do not show up (No-Show), as spots and logistics have already been paid for.

sections.title: 2. Cancellation due to Force Majeure (Weather/Authority)
sections.content: If Northern Chile must cancel due to adverse weather (wind >25 knots, total cloud cover in astronomy) or park closures, the client is entitled to: a) Reschedule at no cost (recommended option), or b) 95% refund of the money paid. The 5% retention applies in all cases to cover payment commissions already charged.

sections.title: 3. Processing Fee Retention
sections.content: A 5% retention applies to all refunds to cover non-recoverable commissions charged by payment processors (Transbank, MercadoPago) including VAT. This retention applies regardless of the cancellation reason, as commissions were charged at the time of the original payment.

sections.title: 4. Refund Timeframes
sections.content: Approved refunds are processed internally within 24 business hours. Depending on your bank or payment method (Webpay/Mercado Pago), the money may take between 5 to 10 business days to reflect in your account.
